title: Can the $2(2j+1)$ component Weinberg-Tucker-Hammer equations describe the electromagnetic field?
abstract: It is shown that the massless $j=1$ Weinberg-Tucker-Hammer equations reduce to the Maxwell's equations for electromagnetic field under the definite choice of field functions and initial and boundary conditions. Thus, the former appear to be of use in a description of some physical processes for which that could be necessitated or be convenient. The possible consequences are discussed.
